**Chocolate Balls (Kadurei Shokolad), the Tunisian Jewish Djerban dish beloved in Israel, visually appear as small, round, solid spheres approximately 1 to 1.5 inches (2.5 to 4 cm) in diameter.** They are dense but tender truffle-like treats, firm enough to hold their shape but not hard, reflecting a rich, cohesive but slightly moist consistency rather than a soupy or stewy texture[1][2][5].
